article:
{{Infobox radio station
 | name = Fresh FM image = airdate = 2001 frequency = 87.7 MHz format = Student
 | owner = Petroc| website =
}} 'Fresh FM' (formerly 'Acorn FM') is a student-run radio station based at the
Barnstaple campus of Petroc, a further education college in North Devon,
England. It broadcasts on 87.7Â MHz FM across the college campus between the
hours of 8:30 and 16:30 on college days. The station has a long term Restricted
Service Licence granted by Ofcom.

The station is presented and run by college students, with a large base of
student presenters and a small number of elected executive committee members who
oversee, manage and make any crucial decisions regarding the station. It
comprises a Station Manager, a Head of Production, a Head of Music, a Head of
IT, a Head of Advertising, a Head of Competitions, a Programme Controller, a
Head of News, a Head of Technical, and a Head of Events, and is often assisted
by an allocated staff member.
categories: Student radio in the United Kingdom
